job_description:
Ready to further your career in the fast-paced, exciting world of cyber security?

Arctic Wolf, with its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry—cybersecurity. We have won countless awards for our excellence in security operations and remain dedicated to providing an industry-leading customer and employee experience.

Our mission is simple: End Cyber Risk. We’re looking for a Senior Developer to be part of making this happen.

About The Role

We are seeking a Senior Developer of Automation Engineering to join our Detect & Protect R&D organization that is responsible for our endpoint, sensor, and scanner technologies which power security related telemetry collection and detection capabilities for our core Arctic Wolf Security Operations Service.

In this role, you will have hands-on automation responsibilities and be a key contributor in helping to deliver on key initiatives that enable phases of a long-term vision for infrastructure and quality automation for the Endpoint Security Platform Team.

Responsibilities

Provide hands-on senior technical leadership on the automation engineering team focused explicitly on strategic automation efforts for the R&D endpoint team. These efforts include infrastructure-as-code environment automation, test suite automation, CI/CD regression test automation, and QE tooling & metrics automation.
Work with R&D leadership to implement key initiatives that are part of internal quality & test automation roadmaps. These projects will span both automation engineering & core development.
Actively define, scope, groom, size, and execute on team backlog deliverables for the automation engineering team.
Actively participate in the broader agile software development lifecycle; contributing quality & automation requirements that may be required for new capabilities and features.
Play an active role in the evolution and automation of core regression test suites. Including CI pipeline integration and final release candidate testing for major/minor GA releases.
Active participation in broader quality & automation guilds in your R&D focus area. Evangelizing quality best practices and identifying critical test automation gaps for roadmap prioritization (performance, integration, system, end-to-end)

Technology Stack Experience

An ideal candidate for this role should have experience in some of these technology stack areas:

Golang, Python, Bash, AWS Cloud Services, Docker, Kubernetes
Cloud Formation, Terraform, Helm, Harness, Nomad, Consul
GitHub, Jenkins, Kabana

Required Skills And Experience

An ideal candidate for this role should meet these minimum requirements:

MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
5+ years relevant hands-on experience in roles spanning quality engineering, test automation, infrastructure automation, or software development in test (SDET)
2+ years’ experience as a senior developer focused on automation efforts across one or more teams.
3+ years of agile/scrum software development experience
Experience interfacing directly with R&D leads on requirements definition and test automation strategies.

Interview Process

Initial Candidate Pre-Screening: A recruiter will contact you to briefly discuss your work history and provide an overview of Arctic Wolf.
Engineering Screening Interview(s): An R&D executive and/or manager will connect to provide more detail context on the organization, team, role, and position. You will share your project and qualifications as it relates to the role you are applying for.
Engineering Technical Interview(s): One or more interviews will be scheduled with potential team members or key stakeholders this position would interface with. Be prepared to collaborate on a technical topics and problems. Also talk more about past projects and your career goals.
Final Engineering Interview: Will be scheduled as required with an R&D executive or manager. Objective is to discuss any final details on the position & opportunity, team & project context, and ensure a final fit with the organization.

Culture & Training

We value an open & transparent engineering culture. Each team has the opportunity to share their work & progress on sprint boundaries during a release cycle and also at R&D department wide meetings. We also hold team & company wide Hackathon events, teaming up across all R&D teams over four days to collaborate and build cool ideas outside the normal project scope. While innovation is the focus, some of these ideas do make it into our products.

You will also receive all the extensive security training you need during our onboarding process to succeed at Arctic Wolf. You can also expect equally extensive on-the-job technical R&D training during the first month of joining your team.

About Arctic Wolf

At Arctic Wolf we’re cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and ideas to make our teams even stronger as we grow globally. We’ve been named one of the 50 Most Innovative Companies in the world for 2022 (Fast Company)—and the 2nd Most Innovative Security Company. This is in addition to consecutive awards from Top Workplace USA (2021, 2022), Best Places to Work - USA (2021, 2022) and Great Place to Work - Canada (2021, 2022).

Our Values

Arctic Wolf recognizes that success comes from delighting our customers, so we work together to ensure that happens every day. We believe in diversity and inclusion, and truly value the unique qualities and unique perspectives all employees bring to the organization. And we appreciate that—by protecting people and organizations’ sensitive data and seeking to end cyber risk— we get to work in an industry that is fundamental to the greater good.

We celebrate unique perspectives by creating a platform for all voices to be heard through our Pack Unity program. We encourage all employees to join or create a new alliance. See more about our Pack Unity here.

We also believe and practice corporate responsibility, and have recently joined the Pledge 1% Movement, ensuring that we continue to give back to our community. We know that through our mission to End Cyber Risk we will continue to engage and give back to our communities.

All Wolves Receive Compelling Compensation And Benefits Packages, Including

Equity for all employees
Bonus or commission pay based on role
Flexible time off, paid volunteer days and paid parental leave
401k/RRSP match
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
Health Savings and Flexible Spending Agreement
Voluntary Legal Insurance
Training and career development programs

Arctic Wolf is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law. Arctic Wolf is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful, and inclusive environment ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. As such, we strive to make our entire employee experience as accessible as possible and provide accommodations as required for candidates and employees with disabilities and/or other specific needs where possible. Security Requirements

Conducts duties and responsibilities in accordance with AWN’s Information Security policies, standards, processes and controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of AWN business information (in accordance with our employee handbook and corporate policies).
Background checks are required for this position
